author: nsantesteban
title: Las ballenas fueron m√°s felices durante la pandemia de la covid
text:
S√≠dney (Australia) (EFE).- Las ballenas jorobadas que migran anualmente por la costa este de Australia fueron m√°s felices durante el primer a√±o de la pademia de covid-19, cuando el pa√≠s oce√°nico aplic√≥ estrictas medidas de confinamiento a su poblaci√≥n, revel√≥ un estudio cient√≠fico publicado este viernes.
La investigaci√≥n realizada por cient√≠ficos de la Universidad de Queensland se apoy√≥ en im√°genes tomadas por drones y las muestras de grasa extra√≠das de varios ejemplares de ballenas jorobadas que transitaron en las aguas cercanas a la Isla North Stradbroke, a unos 100 kil√≥metros del sur de la ciudad de Brisbane.
UQ-led research has found migrating humpback whales off Australia's east coast became less stressed over the first year of the COVID-19 pandemic üêã
üîó https://t.co/JmtyDaIGLn
üìΩÔ∏èJake Linsky @UQscience
‚Äî UQ News (@UQ_News) July 5, 2024 Las im√°genes permitieron observar la condici√≥n corporal y las reservas energ√©ticas de las ballenas jorobadas (Megaptera novaeangliae) durante su larga migraci√≥n anual -entre las aguas ant√°rtidas y zonas ecuatoriales a trav√©s de la costa australiana- y su intenso per√≠odo de crianza.
Asimismo, los cient√≠ficos midieron gen√©ticamente las concentraciones hormonales de la grasa (cortisol y testosterona) ‚Äúdurante un periodo de cambios sin precedentes en la actividad antropog√©nica y los procesos naturales‚Äù, seg√∫n el art√≠culo sobre este estudio publicado en la revista Marine Environment research.
Concentraciones de cortisol significativamente m√°s bajas El an√°lisis de las muestras revel√≥ concentraciones de cortisol significativamente m√°s bajas en las ballenas estudiadas en 2021, en comparaci√≥n con el a√±o anterior.
Las ballenas jorobadas fueron m√°s felices durante el primer a√±o de la pademia de covid-19. EFE/University of Queensland/Dana Cusano ‚ÄúEste cambio en su fisiolog√≠a sugiere una disminuci√≥n de los factores de estr√©s ambiental entre estos dos a√±os‚Äù, dijo el autor principal de este estudio, Jake Linsky, de la Facultad de Medio Ambiente de la Universidad de Queensland, en un comunicado publicado hoy por la instituci√≥n educativa australiana.
Disminuci√≥n de los contaminantes en sus remotas aguas A lo largo de 2020, se aplicaron estrictas medidas de confinamiento y restricci√≥n de movimiento en casi todo el planeta a ra√≠z de la pandemia de la covid, mientras que a la par se iniciaba el fen√≥meno meteorol√≥gico de La Ni√±a, que los cient√≠ficos apuntan que tambi√©n pudo tener cierta influencia en el descenso de estr√©s.
Los resultados gen√©ticos ‚Äúplantean la hip√≥tesis de que las ballenas pueden haber estado respondiendo a una disminuci√≥n de los contaminantes en sus remotas aguas de alimentaci√≥n‚Äù, puntualiz√≥ el cient√≠fico.
Recuperaci√≥n tras la caza de ballenas En la imagen, una ballena adultas y su cr√≠a en la costa este de Australia. EFE/University of Queensland/Jake Linsky Linsky tambi√©n destac√≥ la resiliencia de esta especie que ‚Äúha logrado una de las recuperaciones m√°s exitosas tras la caza hist√≥rica de ballenas‚Äù.
Estudios previos ya han registrado cambios similares en las hormonas del estr√©s en las ballenas en el lado opuesto del continente ant√°rtico, aunque los cient√≠ficos de la Universidad de Queensland sugieren que la nueva investigaci√≥n podr√≠a dar cuenta de que se trat√≥ de un incidente generalizado en todo el Oc√©ano Austral.
La ballena jorobada, tambi√©n conocida como yubarta, es un cet√°ceo de 40 toneladas de peso que puede llegar a medir 20 metros, con un cuerpo caracter√≠stico que recuerda a una joroba.
La poblaci√≥n de ballenas jorobadas de Australia, que tiene dos poblaciones migratorias que navegan por sus costas oeste y este, es de 70.000 ejemplares, un n√∫mero que ha ido aumentando por las medidas de protecci√≥n implementadas por el pa√≠s.

author: Dan Belson
title: Conservative group runs $200k ad blitz blaming Rachel Morin killing on Biden policies
text: A digital ad campaign blaming the killing of Rachel Morin on President Joe Biden‚Äôs immigration policies is targeting audiences in swing states this week. The roughly $200,000 ad blitz comes as Biden prepares for his first debate this election season with former president Donald Trump, who has seized on Morin‚Äôs death to attack his Democratic opponent‚Äôs border policies. The ad campaign was bankrolled by a conservative group called ‚ÄúBuilding America Better,‚Äù which had already spent more than $724,000 this year on two ads, according to Federal Elections Commission filings. No disclosure about the most recent ad campaign had been filed with the commission Thursday afternoon. Both of those election year ads also play on fears over immigration, interspersing news reels of crimes allegedly committed by immigrants with statements from either of the presidential candidates. Morin‚Äôs killing immediately reached national attention last August after the mother of five was found dead on the Ma & Pa Trail in Bel Air. But months later, after authorities identified the suspect as a 23-year-old from El Salvador who entered the United States unlawfully, the Harford County homicide quickly became the latest center of the nationwide flareup over U.S. immigration and border policy. Thursday‚Äôs debate comes amid that flareup. Trump, who has long made inflammatory statements about immigrants , and other Republicans have targeted the Biden administration on immigration over the Morin case, claiming deficiencies have allowed criminals into the country. Democrats have responded by noting the GOP‚Äôs rejection of border enforcement measures that could have aided Biden politically during the election year. A website for Building America‚Äôs Future does not disclose much more than its other campaigns, which include a six-figure ad targeting swing states opposing the Biden administration‚Äôs proposed rules that ban menthol cigarettes. The tax-exempt group formed in 2020 named Chris Jankowski, who ran a super PAC supporting Trump‚Äôs former rival Ron DeSantis, as one of its officers in a 2023 filing to Virginia business regulators. Jankowski‚Äôs name was removed in an annual report filed Thursday morning that names several other Washington-area political strategists in its list of officers. Morin‚Äôs mother has ‚Äúhad a chance to view‚Äù the 60-second video that anchors the digital ad campaign but ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt have any comments right now,‚Äù said Randolph Rice, an attorney who represents Patty Morin and other family members. Shortly after 23-year-old Victor Martinez-Hernandez was arrested in connection with Morin‚Äôs killing, Trump called Morin‚Äôs mother, Patty, to express his condolences. Patty said she was ‚Äúdeeply touched by President Trump‚Äôs kindness and concern‚Äù in an earlier statement released by the family‚Äôs attorney. Matthew McMahon, the father of Rachel Morin‚Äôs oldest daughter, said he had viewed the video and is ‚Äúappalled.‚Äù ‚ÄúThey are using Rachel to divide the country,‚Äù McMahon said, noting that he felt the video held an ‚Äúunderlying tone of division.‚Äù He said the video ‚Äúseems to highlight to me that it is not about Rachel being murdered‚Äù but rather about the suspect, ‚Äúbecause they wouldn‚Äôt care if it was a citizen of the U.S.‚Äù He said that Rachel‚Äôs estate ‚Äî administered by his and Morin‚Äôs daughter, Faye ‚Äî was not contacted by the video‚Äôs producers. ‚ÄúNobody even bothered to ask Rachel‚Äôs estate how they feel about the video, or even a heads up that they were going to make it,‚Äù McMahon said. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt sit well with me because she is being used.‚Äù When asked if he would watch the debate Thursday, McMahon said he took the time to set a reminder to make sure he doesn‚Äôt miss it because he is prepared ‚Äúto watch Rachel be used‚Äù as a ‚Äúcampaign issue.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt how people should be remembering Rachel because they are setting everything that was Rachel aside so they can focus on the legal status of the person that attacked her,‚Äù McMahon said, describing Morin as open, forgiving and compassionate. ‚ÄúRachel was a uniter.‚Äù The digital ad blitz, which the conservative group said also includes ‚Äúmobile billboards and 2D projections on famous buildings,‚Äù is anchored by a 60-second video that opens with a woman with similar characteristics to Morin walking in a wooded area. ‚ÄúIt just keeps happening,‚Äù a female narrator says over the dramatization of Morin‚Äôs final moments. The voice mentions Laken Riley, a nursing student whose death has also become a flashpoint in the recent immigration debate. The voice in the ad says that Riley ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt the first‚Äù and ‚Äúin Joe Biden‚Äôs America, sadly she won‚Äôt be the last‚Äù before a gasp is heard and the footage from the woods cuts out to show news coverage of Morin‚Äôs death and Martinez-Hernandez‚Äôs arrest. The ad, which closes by calling Biden‚Äôs border policies ‚Äúa nightmare for American women,‚Äù will be shown on digital platforms in seven swing states that are key to this year‚Äôs presidential election ‚Äî Nevada, Arizona, Michigan, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, North Carolina and Georgia, according to the group sponsoring it. The group spent more than $685,000 on a previous ad campaign focused on Riley‚Äôs killing. One of those ads uses clips of Biden in an attempt to portray him as unwilling to control the border, juxtaposing his statements with newsreels of crime coverage and Trump‚Äôs controversial words from his 2016 presidential campaign launch ‚Äî that immigrants from Mexico are ‚Äúbringing drugs, they‚Äôre bringing crime, they‚Äôre rapists. And some, I assume, are good people.‚Äù

author: Emma Boff
title: The Manchester man on a mission to find and publish stories of WWII veterans nationwide

[](https://www.geoffreysmith.org/valuation-request?utm_source=InYourArea.co.uk) The Manchester man on a mission to find and publish stories of WWII veterans nationwide Find out the latest events happening in and around the Rochdale area from December 30, from All Across the Arts columnist Steve Cooke WHAT'S ON: Gary Bridson-Daley pictured with an Arnhem veteran in Holland as part of his historic project Gary Bridson-Daley 's Debt Of Gratitude Project Review: Steve Cooke History is mainly written about the elite who dominated events and bestrode their eras. Such as Churchill, Henry VIII, Elizabeth I, Victoria, and Oliver Cromwell. What is in much shorter supply are the stories of the ordinary people who were caught up in these momentous events and whose lives were shaped by the era they lived in. Bucking this trend and recording the lives of ordinary folk who did extraordinary things is Gary Bridson-Daley with his Debt of Gratitude Project. Gary has been working non-stop as a one-man band to find and honour WW2 veterans throughout the UK, to interview them, record and publish their stories. His tireless work has produced two amazing books containing almost a hundred Army, Navy, Air Force, Special Forces, Intelligence and Home Front Civilian WW2 Veterans. A Debt of Gratitude to The Last Heroes (foreword by Dame Vera Lynn) and The Last Stand - Memories of War (foreword by The Last British Dambuster George 'Johnny' Johnson) that was published in May this year and has now also just been released in December in two 'Special Edition' formats which contain a new D-Day and Arnhem Veteran in time for next year's big 80th Anniversaries and 10,000 words more and additional pictures and illustrations. READ MORE [The Rochdale comedy night with a growing reputation for plenty of laughs](https://www.inyourarea.co.uk/news/rochdale-comedy-night-growing-reputation-plenty-laughs/) [‚ÄòIt all feels like a dream!‚Äô - veteran celebrates 100th birthday with Manchester City surprise](https://www.inyourarea.co.uk/news/it-all-feels-like-a-dream-veteran-celebrates-100-birthday-manchester-city-surprise/) Debt of Gratitude is relevant not just during big war anniversaries but is timeless due to what has been captured! The special editions are in black-and-white and colour and are highly recommended gifts for anyone at any time who has an interest in World War Two, UK History, history in general and most importantly the ordinary unsung folk who made our history. You can view all editions whilst on the [Amazon page here](https://www.amazon.co.uk/Last-Stand-Memories-Special%20Additional/dp/B0CPPR9CZ9/ref=monarch_sidesheet) for the new book. Look on the right-hand side under the main book title for a link that says - 'See all formats and editions', click on there to look into any of the three available versions. I first met the impressive Gary Bridson-Daly as he embarked on this vital project and have kept in touch ever since. On a recant catch up he told me: "My work to capture the precious stories of our dwindling World War Two generation as part of my 'Debt of Gratitude Project' still continues, its principle aims being to find, record and capture the vitally important historical testimonies of a generation who very sadly will soon disappear over the horizon of human history, and by being one the few recording as many of these stories as possible to save them for this and future generations, by getting into the public domain through the books I write and feature them in, I feel I am passionately pursuing something very important that can and will benefit many people both now and in the future! I have now been running my 'Debt of Gratitude Project' for nearly a decade, and have personally funded every aspect of it myself, having used all my savings to do so, having to pay for transport, accommodation, food, and all other related costs in order to reach and be with the Veterans all over the country so that I can personally conduct the interviews and get these gems of stories in little time we have left. I have done over 150 already but have now exhausted all my financial means to continue doing this, and with other interviews lined up I desperately need help with funding to reach these people before it's too late and we lose their stories forever which is why I have launched my GoFundMe Appeal! Any and All help is greatly appreciated." Gary is local lad, Manchester born, now living in Salford who has written his books here in the North-West and has interviewed a lot of local WW2 Veterans from greater Manchester who are included in both books! I urge you to give what support you can to this wonderful project to enable Gary to keep going as our WW2 Veterans are passing at an alarming rate. If you would like to support Gary, please visit [the website here](https://www.gofundme.com/f/debt-of-gratitude-project?qid=b9f3705261880faabea0e9167b385963). Plenty to Look Forward to in 2024 at Ebor Preview: Steve Cooke There is a lot to look forward to in 2024 at EBOR studio in Littleborough. Farewell Winter Celebration (Feb 17: 4-6pm) Bid adieu to the chilly vibes and welcome the warm embrace of spring with Ebor. Procure original artworks and play party games. Drawing and Sound Workshop (February 24, 10am - 12.30pm) Join Maryanne Royle and Alice Jennings in an instructed workshop exploring soundscape and drawing with all abilities welcome. Create a playable soundscape in collaboration with other participants on tape with sound artist and cassette tape enthusiast Maryanne Royle using your own sounds. Then be led in a drawing session inspired by the soundscape with ceramic artist Alice Jennings. Book on using the [weblink here](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/drawing-and-sound-workshop-tickets-765238528037?utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-medium=discovery&utm-term=listing&utm-source=cp&aff=ebdsshcopyurl). Open Studio (April 13, 12-4pm) Once a year EBOR open their doors so you can meet creative members and see what a real artist studio looks like! They have seventeen studio artists and designers from a wide range of mediums. A number of EBOR Associate Members will have their work on show in Gallery FRANK. Associate Members Show 2024 13th of April to the 1st of May Opening April 13th 12 - 4pm [Ebor Studio](https://www.eborstudio.co.uk/), William Street, Littleborough OL15 8JP RECOMMENDED Rochdale Photographic Society (January 3, 2024) Tonight's session - creative photography evening. We meet every Wednesday at Rochdale Unitarian Church, starting at 7.30pm prompt (doors open from 7.15pm). The door is kept locked so please ring the bell on arrival. If you would like to see the club for yourself and meet our members, you are welcome to attend as our guest for up to 3 weeks before committing to membership. Annual subscription is ¬£36 for single or ¬£46 for joint membership. Cost: A weekly room fee of ¬£2.50 is also payable on arrival at the meeting. Refreshments are 50p. Time: Doors open 7.15pm, 7.30pm start. Address: Rochdale Unitarian Church, Clover Street, Rochdale OL12 6TP. Gallery Exhibitions: Mixed Media (Until January 7, 2024) Wardle Art Group - Mixed Media. Most items on display are available to purchase. Cost: Free. Time: 10am - 3pm. Phone: Littleborough Coach House 01706 378481 Address: Littleborough Coach House, Lodge Street, Littleborough OL15 9AE. [All Across the Arts](https://www.allacrossthearts.com/) - AATA - celebrates creative arts and artists. An oasis of positivity supporting individual and community wellbeing. Get all your latest news and updates in [Rochdale, Greater Manchester](https://www.inyourarea.co.uk/areas-we-cover/England/Greater%20Manchester/Rochdale)
